description.value: Searches a log file for a regular expression and returns if a new line was found, and the last line number to contain the regex.

property.label: OS
property.description: The operating system of the server containing the log file.

property.label: Directory
property.description: The network path to the shared filed on the server that contains the log file. Example: /myapplication/logs/ This entry will be combined with the host name to create the network path to the file: //localhost/myapplication/logs/

property.label: File Regex
property.description: If this is selected then the file must be specified in terms of a regex expression. If the directory contains multiple files that match the regex the newest file will be selected

property.label: File
property.description: The File that you wish to search. If the File Regex option is checked, then this must be a regex. If running using Windows, this file must be shared to the user running the dynaTrace Collector.

property.label: Search Term
property.description: A regex of what you wish to search for within the log file. The search is completed per line. Example .*Warning.*

property.label: Database Type
property.description: The type of database where the log file scraper entries will be stored.

property.label: Database Server
property.description: Database server to contain the repository of log file searches.

property.label: Database Port
property.description: Port to connect to on the database server. Default ports are: Oracle: 1521, SQL Server: 1433, PostGreSQL: 5432

property.label: Database Name
property.description: The database to use for the log file repository.

property.label: Database Username
property.description: Username used to connect to the SQL Database

property.label: Database Password
property.description: The password for the username used to connect to the SQL database

property.label: Additional Lines
property.description: Amount of additional lines to be captured from the file after the log message is found.

property.label: Skip Additional Records
property.description: If this box is checked, records included in the additional lines will be skipped for processing.

property.label: Keep Historical Record
property.description: If this box is check a historical record of the each log message will be added to the LogMessageHistoricalRecord database. This database can then be queried for a list of all log messages matching a specific search and the corresponding timestamps.

metric.name: New Message
metric.description: Returns a 1 if a new entry was made to log file with the search term specified.

metric.name: Line Number
metric.description: The Line Number of the last known occurance of the specified search term.

metric.name: Number of Messages
metric.description: The number of lines that matched the Search Term.
